page.title: 17CELEBRATIONS IN GOLDTHORPE
page.content: My Grandma can remember all this happening in{May 1945.}Just about everybody was sitting round the radio listening for news of the end of{World {War II.}When it came through everybody jumped for joy, screaming, crying and shouting. Then there were bonfires, fireworks, parties and flags hanging out of windows and across streets. People went to Pubs. Many got drunk to celebrate the{Victory.}There were large numbers of people killed or injured in the War. This year we have had the{40th Anniversary}of the celebrations. T.V.A.M. had a party to celebrate the Anniversary on television. It was organised outside the T.V.A.M. studio in London, tables were set out in a V shape. In the Goldthorpe area there were very few celebrations of the Anniversary.
